cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s Big Bend, afterwards sweeping across southeast Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before emerging over the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No tropical storm or hurricane warnings currently in effect for Georgia or South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend), southeast Georgia, entire Georgia coast including Port of Savannah, coastal South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (NHC forecast 4–8 inches for southeast Georgia)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (NHC surge guidance 2–4 ft from Mouth of St. Mary’s River to South Santee River)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible; 60% chance of ≥34 kt and 22% chance of ≥50 kt, peak late Wednesday into early Thursday with gusts 40–55 kt on the Georgia coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in the Savannah River estuary and adjacent Georgia coast around high tide late Wednesday/early Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding in the Savannah area Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, brief port access restrictions due to high water levels
